DOC.HEAD: Ford Recalls 64,000 Cars, Trucks for Emission Problems
DOC.TEXT: Ford Motor Co. on Monday recalled 64,115 cars and light trucks because of emission system problems. The company said it was recalling 64,000 1986 model Lincoln Town Cars, Continentals and Mark VIIs; Ford Crown Victoria, Thunderbird and Mustang; Mercury Grand Marquis, Cougar and Capri and some 1987 Lincoln Mark VII cars with 5-liter or 5-liter, high-output engines. Ford said testing by the California Air Resources Board showed emissions of hydrocarbon to be too high. The company will replace fuel injectors and other equipment. In a separate action, Ford recalled 115 1989 model F-250 and F-350 light trucks with 5.8-liter engines and manual transmissions which may emit too much carbon monoxide. Owners in both actions are being notified by mail and repair work will be performed free of charge.
